Abstract: This narrative review examines disparities in eye care access and utilization across diverse populations. It explores factors contributing to inequities in ophthalmological services, including socioeconomic status, race/ethnicity, geographic location, and health literacy. The review synthesizes current literature on barriers to eye care, highlighting the impact on vision health outcomes and quality of life. Findings emphasize the need for targeted interventions and policy changes to promote health equity in eye care delivery and improve overall population eye health.
